definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

sentences.english: This week’s demonstration was designed to drum up interest in the platform.
sentences.chinese: 本週的演示是爲了招徠對這個平臺的關注。

sentences.english: The advertisements for the concert fetched in large crowds.
sentences.chinese: 音樂會的廣告招徠了大量聽衆。

sentences.english: Several men stood outside the ground, touting for the various sideshows.
sentences.chinese: 好幾個人站在場外，爲正在演出的各類雜耍招徠觀衆。

sentences.english: But when it is also chaotic, it causes pain and suffering and calls for attention.
sentences.chinese: 只有當運作失序時，它才引發痛苦並招徠注視。

sentences.english: Moreover, Ames is a bring-your-own-voters affair.
sentences.chinese: 而且，艾姆斯市是招徠自己支持者投票的地方。

sentences.english: Come to know the consequences of rebellion will bring severe judgment from God.
sentences.chinese: 認識頑梗背逆的結果，必定招徠神嚴厲的審判。

sentences.english: It is the eye-catcher that visitors use to get to the shop.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個非常吸引人的結構，它能招徠顧客。

definition: to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
public/publicly (owned, financed, operated etc)/run by the state
startup (company, phase etc)/newly established/in the early stages
to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
the catering industry/the hotel and restaurant business
front yard as busy as a marketplace (idiom)/a place with many visitors
